text: it took us three months to arrange an
interview with Edward Snowden via an
encrypted app we were told to go to
Moscow check into a hotel and provide a
room number then Edward Snowden would
come and knock on the door he explained
why he did come here I saw that all of
our communications were being
intercepted all of the time in the
absence of any suspicion of wrongdoing
and this was something that was
occurring without our knowledge without
our consent one of his concerns about
GCHQ that's the government's electronic
ears and eyes was its ability to hack
into our personal data on our
smartphones it's called computer network
exploitation or CNE he told us about a
secret GCHQ training program code-named
Smurfs
after cartoon characters devised by the
Belgian comic artist peyo
dreamy Smurf is the power management
tool which means turning your phone on
or off without you knowing
even if I've turned my phone off right
and then we've got nosy Smurf what's a
nosy Smurf nosy Smurf is the the hot
miking tool so for example if it's in
your pocket they can turn the microphone
on and listen to everything that's going
on around you
trekker Smurfs what's track of Smurf
that's a geolocation tool which allows
them to follow you with a greater
precision they want to own your phone
instead of you he also described how
GCHQ secretly hacked vast amounts of
communications data from inside Pakistan
presumably to help identify and track
terrorists it did so by secretly hacking
digital junction boxes manufactured by
the American company
Cisco they'll hack those network service
providers and secretly take ownership of
the devices without the service
providers knowing about without the
service providers ever knowing about it
the hacking of Cisco's devices was
secretly signed off by the government
GCHQ won't confirm or deny any of this
but says all it does is legal both the
US and British governments believe
Edward Snowden has betrayed the trust
placed in him onto a traitor
of course not the question is if I was a
trader who did i betray the American
people because you betrayed the
intelligence agencies whose prime
responsibility is to protect the
American people an argument could be
made that I betrayed the government to
protect the people but what is likely to
happen to him is he doomed forever to
remain in Moscow or will he return home
to America stand trial and go to jail
for what he has done do you have any
regrets about what you've done I regret
that I didn't come forward sooner I have
paid a price but I feel comfortable with
the decisions I made
you
